Description: Pottery bowl of Nile silt clay with organic inclusions, with flat base and convex sides, coated with a red slip and burnished broadly on the exterior and half way down the walls in the interior. There are several small areas of smoke discolouration on exterior.
Curator's comments: Marked 5227 on the side, but this vessel is not mentioned in the text for this grave in Brunton and Caton-Thompson, Badarian Civilisation, (London 1928), 9. Most like Polished red PR15H in Brunton and Caton-Thompson 1928, but fabric is more like the Smooth Brown class.
Acquisition name: Donated by: British School of Archaeology, Egypt
